story.title: Live #ShakespeareQS with project curator of #ShakespeareExhibition, Becky Allen
story.description: On the day of the live Q&A, the Museum: received 323 mentions, gained 409 (559-150) followers (more than ask a curator day), 356 clicks on links shared, 168 Retweets, 25 favourites. Mentions from partnership organisations: Penguin, World Shakespeare Festival, RSC, The Globe

author.name: British Museum
author.bio: A museum of the world, for the world.

quote.text: At 1pm, project curator of the #ShakespeareExhibition, Becky Allen, will be answering questions in a live #ShakespeareQS on @britishmuseum

quote.text: If you're on Twitter, from 1-2pm today project curator of Shakespeare: staging the world at the British Museum, Becky Allen, will be answering questions about the exhibition in a live Q&A. Tag your questions with #ShakespeareQS to join in!

meta.message: If you're on Twitter, from 1-2pm today project curator of Shakespeare: staging the world at the British Museum, Becky Allen, will be answering questions about the exhibition in a live Q&A. Tag your questions with #ShakespeareQS to join in!

quote.text: .@soupdragon2000 The exhib aims to create a dialogue between object and text so we had to make lots of tough decisions about what to include

quote.text: @britishmuseum How long were you working on/ researching the exhibition before it opened? #ShakespeareQS

user.description: Dedicated to the arts, belong in the wild.
user.name: Melissa Darby

meta.text: @britishmuseum How long were you working on/ researching the exhibition before it opened? #ShakespeareQS

quote.text: .@mdarby1989 I started last May but Dora Thornton, the Lead Curator, had spent 2 years before then selecting objects and writing the book

quote.text: @britishmuseum dear becky, what has been your favourite piece of audience feedback? #ShakespeareQS

meta.text: @britishmuseum dear becky, what has been your favourite piece of audience feedback? #ShakespeareQS

quote.text: @britishmuseum Becky, which Shakespeare character do you most identify yourself with and why? #ShakespeareQS

user.description: Copywriter, editor, wannabe Don Draper (without the smoking and misogyny). Geekier tweets by @britishmuseum are mine. All tweets are my own views (probably).
user.name: Andrew Shore

meta.text: @britishmuseum Becky, which Shakespeare character do you most identify yourself with and why? #ShakespeareQS

quote.text: .@andrew_shore I adore Portia in 'Merchant' - she is smart, sassy and brilliant in the court scene - but I might be more of a Lady Macbeth!

user.description: A museum of the world, for the world. Now open: #ShakespeareExhibition http://www.britishmuseum.org/shakespeare
user.name: British Museum

meta.text: .@andrew_shore I adore Portia in 'Merchant' - she is smart, sassy and brilliant in the court scene - but I might be more of a Lady Macbeth!

quote.text: @britishmuseum #ShakespeareQS I visited the exhibition. An eclectic mix. What one item did you want to put in but missed the cut?

user.description: Claire Madge - Everything Museum. Museum volunteer, mum of 3. Loving all things Museum. Kids in Museums, Education in Museums. Fun in Museums !
user.name: Tincture Of Museum

meta.text: @britishmuseum #ShakespeareQS I visited the exhibition. An eclectic mix. What one item did you want to put in but missed the cut?

quote.text: .@TinctureOfMuse We have lots of paintings in the exhib but there were many more we would have loved to have - we ran out of wall space!

user.description: A museum of the world, for the world. Now open: #ShakespeareExhibition http://www.britishmuseum.org/shakespeare
user.name: British Museum

meta.text: .@TinctureOfMuse We have lots of paintings in the exhib but there were many more we would have loved to have - we ran out of wall space!

quote.text: @britishmuseum thank you. It must have been very hard to pick the exhibits. Loved the visual and aural working together.

user.description: Claire Madge - Everything Museum. Museum volunteer, mum of 3. Loving all things Museum. Kids in Museums, Education in Museums. Fun in Museums !
user.name: Tincture Of Museum

meta.text: @britishmuseum thank you. It must have been very hard to pick the exhibits. Loved the visual and aural working together.

quote.text: LIVE CHAT NOW! Project curator of #ShakespeareExhibition at the @britishmuseum, Becky Allen: use #ShakespeareQS to join in!

user.description: For University of Warwick students/graduates interested in careers in the arts, culture and media industries. Tweets by Kimberley Counsell & Stephanie Redding.
user.name: Warwick Arts Careers

meta.text: LIVE CHAT NOW! Project curator of #ShakespeareExhibition at the @britishmuseum, Becky Allen: use #ShakespeareQS to join in!

quote.text: @britishmuseum #shakespeareQS hi Becky. I loved the exhibition! How did you decide on the different areas/zones to focus on?

user.description: I work at the Science Museum, coordinating all the lovely volunteers. Chairman of the excellent Argosy Players :)
user.name: Sally Munday

meta.text: @britishmuseum #shakespeareQS hi Becky. I loved the exhibition! How did you decide on the different areas/zones to focus on?

quote.text: .@sallyrmunday We wanted to focus on Shakespeare's places of imagination - places and ideas which had meaning for him and his audiences

user.description: A museum of the world, for the world. Now open: #ShakespeareExhibition http://www.britishmuseum.org/shakespeare
user.name: British Museum

meta.text: .@sallyrmunday We wanted to focus on Shakespeare's places of imagination - places and ideas which had meaning for him and his audiences

quote.text: @britishmuseum #ShakespeareQS and where did the inspiration for the exhibit come from?

user.description: Stage combat teacher, trained actor, driving instructor, workshop facilitator and weight watchers leader. All in all pretty busy!
user.name: claire llewellyn

meta.text: @britishmuseum #ShakespeareQS and where did the inspiration for the exhibit come from?

quote.text: .@combatclaire It's a collaboration with @TheRSC and Shakespearean Jonathan Bate. He had the idea of exploring Shakespeare's Imagined Places

user.description: A museum of the world, for the world. Now open: #ShakespeareExhibition http://www.britishmuseum.org/shakespeare
user.name: British Museum

meta.text: .@combatclaire It's a collaboration with @TheRSC and Shakespearean Jonathan Bate. He had the idea of exploring Shakespeare's Imagined Places

quote.text: @britishmuseum Rebecca, what's been your favourite 'punter's comment' you've happened to catch? #ShakespeareQS

user.description: Actor - Photographer. I don't wear glasses and I don't smoke..
user.name: Jim Creighton

meta.text: @britishmuseum Rebecca, what's been your favourite 'punter's comment' you've happened to catch? #ShakespeareQS

quote.text: @CreightonJim Lots of people remark on how handsome Jonjo O'Neill is - he's a very dashing Richard III...http://ow.ly/emxt0

quote.text: @britishmuseum #ShakespeareQS Why do you feel that Shakespeare is still so important & relevant today, asides from in literary history?

user.description: Photography editor at @cubmagazine, Head of Design at @QMLitSoc, photographer for @QueenMaryRAG & member of V&A #createvoice | http://www.laurablair.co.uk
user.name: Laura Blair

meta.text: @britishmuseum #ShakespeareQS Why do you feel that Shakespeare is still so important & relevant today, asides from in literary history?

quote.text: .@heartsofsand I think it's because he understands human nature and was clearly brilliant at absorbing information and ideas #ShakespeareQS

meta.text: Just 10 mins left to ask project curator Becky Allen a question about the #ShakespeareExhibition! Use the hash tag #ShakespeareQS

quote.text: @britishmuseum What did you learn about Shakespeare while working on the exhibit? #ShakespeareQS

user.description: artist, printmaker, and writer
user.name: violentbloom

meta.text: @britishmuseum What did you learn about Shakespeare while working on the exhibit? #ShakespeareQS

quote.text: .@violentbloom I realised how popular the London playhouse was when Shakes wrote his plays - it was a new medium with enormous mass appeal

meta.text: .@violentbloom I realised how popular the London playhouse was when Shakes wrote his plays - it was a new medium with enormous mass appeal

quote.text: @britishmuseum Shakespeare is Britain's número uno, but if curating for the worlds "top 3", who would you like to do? :) #ShakespeareQS

user.description: i'm an archaeologist....in answer to your questions: yes, it is wonderful...no, i've not found gold...yes, i did watch walking with dinosaurs...
user.name: 1manonabicycle

meta.text: @britishmuseum Shakespeare is Britain's número uno, but if curating for the worlds "top 3", who would you like to do? :) #ShakespeareQS

quote.text: @1manonabicycle that's a great question. I'd love to do an exhibition about another playwright - Ibsen, Brecht, Chekov- there's a long list!

user.description: A museum of the world, for the world. Now open: #ShakespeareExhibition http://www.britishmuseum.org/shakespeare
user.name: British Museum

meta.text: @1manonabicycle that's a great question. I'd love to do an exhibition about another playwright - Ibsen, Brecht, Chekov- there's a long list!

quote.text: .@kathrynhavelock Harriet Walter performing Cleopatra's poignant suicide speech is my favourite performance http://ow.ly/emyG1

user.description: A museum of the world, for the world. Now open: #ShakespeareExhibition http://www.britishmuseum.org/shakespeare
user.name: British Museum

meta.text: .@kathrynhavelock Harriet Walter performing Cleopatra's poignant suicide speech is my favourite performance http://t.co/8Dr5r8bX

quote.text: Thanks for all your questions. The exhibition is on until 25 November - I hope you enjoy it! http://ow.ly/emzDr

user.description: A museum of the world, for the world. Now open: #ShakespeareExhibition http://www.britishmuseum.org/shakespeare
user.name: British Museum

meta.text: Thanks for all your questions. The exhibition is on until 25 November - I hope you enjoy it! http://t.co/H2KXAVIe

quote.text: Thanks to Becky Allen @ the @britishmuseum for a fab Twitter Q&A on Shakespeare today. Search #ShakespeareQS or see BM's timeline to follow.

meta.text: Thanks to Becky Allen @ the @britishmuseum for a fab Twitter Q&A on Shakespeare today. Search #ShakespeareQS or see BM's timeline to follow.

quote.text: Really impressed by the @britishmuseum answering qus about the new exhibition! Very interesting, thanks!

user.description: Tweets are mostly about injuries acquired whilst eating, or whilst trying to eat. When I grow up I want to be @lucy_worsley
user.name: Charlotte G

meta.text: Really impressed by the @britishmuseum answering qus about the new exhibition! Very interesting, thanks!

quote.text: Really enjoying reading the @britishmuseum #ShakespeareExhibition twitter Q+As - a great way to get people involved

user.name: Kezia Evans
